meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a haustorium.
meanings.sent1: The haustorial plant had unique haustorial roots that helped it absorb nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the haustorial structure to understand its haustorial nature.
meanings.sent3: The haustorial flower looked like a haustorial alien from another planet.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was haustorial, always seeking to learn and grow.
meanings.sent5: The haustorial pattern on the fabric was intricate and beautiful.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a specialized absorbing structure in certain parasitic plants.
meanings.sent1: The haustorial vine wrapped around the tree, showing its haustorial function.
meanings.sent2: The haustorial adaptation of the plant allowed it to thrive in its environment.
meanings.sent3: The haustorial plant was like a sneaky thief stealing nutrients from its host.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was haustorial, deeply rooted and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The haustorial mechanism of the parasite was both fascinating and concerning.

meanings.definition: Capable of or adapted for sucking or absorbing.
meanings.sent1: The haustorial roots of the plant were efficient at haustorial absorption.
meanings.sent2: The haustorial ability of the organism allowed it to survive in harsh conditions.
meanings.sent3: The haustorial sponge soaked up water like a thirsty haustorial desert.
meanings.sent4: His charm was haustorial, drawing people in effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The haustorial nature of the vacuum cleaner made cleaning a breeze.
